intro: Coccolobis uvifera, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow, orange, or red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. It thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its ecological and cultural significance, it is an important species in Hawaiian botany.
